title: Explosive claims emerge of Bill Gates' ties to Jeffrey Epstein | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Billionaire Bill Gates has rejected allegations in the latest release of Epstein files as "absolutely absurd and completely false". The latest documents indicate Mr Gates met with the late convicted sex offender on multiple occasions after Jeffrey Epstein's prison sentence.  In one email sent to himself in 2013, Epstein appears to suggest that Mr Gates contracted a sexually transmitted disease and sought to secretly give his then-wife, Melinda French Gates, antibiotics. Harry Melkonian from the US Studies Centre spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the possible consequences from the latest release of the Epstein files. title: Three Australians have died in Japan's snowfields this ski season | ABC NEWS
description: Three Australians have died after separate incidents in Japan over the current ski season.  The death toll includes Rylan Pribadi, Michael Hurst and Brooke Day.  Japanese authorities are urging tourists to remain cautious, with the country forecast to receive more record-breaking snowfall in the coming weeks. title: White House to withdraw 700 federal agents from Minnesota | ABC NEWS
description: The Trump administration is withdrawing 700 federal officers from Minneapolis, as the White House scales back its immigration crackdown in Minnesota.  The city's mayor Jacob Frey has welcomed the move but renewed his call for the full removal of federal officers. About 2,000 officers will remain in the state.  Border tsar Tom Homan, who recently took over the operation after the fatal shootings of US citizens Renee Good and Alex Pretti by ICE agents, says conditions are now ‘safe’ for some federal personnel to pull out of Minneapolis. title: US-Ukraine-Russia peace talks underway as Moscow renews strikes on Ukraine's energy grid | ABC NEWS
description: Russia, Ukraine and the US have wrapped up the first day of peace talks in Abu Dhabi. But there are growing concerns the talks will have any chance of success as Moscow continues its systematic strikes on Ukraine’s energy sector. title: Why the gold price has gone crazy | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Ever since Donald Trump’s Liberation Day tariffs were announced in April last year, the price of gold has been rising.   Its price is about 80 percent higher than it was a year ago and it’s still near its all time record after a recent sell off.   So, what’s been moving the price of gold and what does it say about investor’s faith in the US and global economy?    Today, business correspondent David Taylor on why Australians have been queuing to buy the shiny metal and where the price could go next.    Featured:    David Taylor, ABC business correspondent

title: Israel and Hamas accuse each other of violating ceasefire | ABC NEWS
description: The ceasefire in Gaza is on shaky ground as Gazan health officials report at least 23 deaths from Israeli military strikes. The Israeli military says the strikes were carried out in response to militant gunfire that injured one of its soldiers. title: Isaac Herzog 'should not be welcomed into Australia': UN commissioner | ABC NEWS
description: UN-appointed commissioner Chris Sidoti says inviting Israeli President Isaac Herzog to Australia was a "mistake" that "undermines social cohesion." The controversial visit was arranged by the government after the Bondi Beach terror attack, in what the prime minister says is an opportunity to foster national unity after tragedy. Commissioner Sidoti warns Herzog is a divisive figure, and leads what can be regarded as a 'rogue state'. He points to statements made by the president after the October 7 Hamas terror attack that a UN inquiry found were an incitement to genocide of Palestinians. Herzog says his words have been twisted to claim he was calling for collective punishment. title: 100,000 bony bream dead at Lake Menindee fish kill | ABC NEWS
description: It's estimated 100,000 native bony bream are dead in Lake Menindee after a fish kill at Sunset Strip. It came after a week of record-breaking heat followed by a sharp decrease in temperature. description: Queensland will expand its ‘adult crime, adult time’ laws for a second time. Premier David Crisafulli says police data showed a 7.2 per cent drop in victims of crime in 2025 and is proof the government's approach to tackle youth crime is the right one. description: Matt Nolan from e61 Institute says the Capital gains tax discount is overcompensating people and overwhelmingly benefits the wealthy. title: Armed groups kill nearly 200 in separate massacres in Nigeria | ABC NEWS
description: Gunmen have killed at least 170 people in separate attacks on villages in Nigeria.  The IS-linked Lakurawa group was reportedly responsible for deadly raids on two remote villages in the country’s west, while at least 21 people were killed in a mass shooting in Katsina’s Doma village.  The US has dispatched a small taskforce to Nigeria to deal with the crisis. title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania | ABC NEWS
description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.  The dwindling population has been a matter of concern for years and is now at a critically low level, the government says. title: What will happen after the US-Russia nuclear treaty expires? | ABC NEWS
description: An arms control treaty designed to prevent a nuclear war between the US and Russia is set to expire this week, sparking fears of a new arms race between the superpowers.  Tensions between Washington and Moscow over the Ukraine war have put the future of the Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (START I)  into doubt, with neither the White House or the Kremlin expressing an interest in extending the agreement.  The Australian Strategic Policy Institute’s Courtney Stewart says the end of these non-proliferation guardrails marks a ‘huge loss’ for global security.
